meanings.definition: To return to a previous state or condition.
meanings.sent1: After trying to learn new tricks, the dog regresses to its old habits.
meanings.sent2: As winter approaches, the weather regresses to colder temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The time machine malfunctioned, causing everything to regress back to the dinosaur era!
meanings.sent4: Her mind regresses to childhood memories when she visits her old neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The software update caused the system to regress to an earlier version, losing all recent changes.

meanings.definition: To move backward or away from a point.
meanings.sent1: The car regresses slowly down the steep hill.
meanings.sent2: As the hiker climbed higher, the trail regresses into the dense forest.
meanings.sent3: The snail decided to regress instead of moving forward, much to the amusement of the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The river regresses from the city, flowing back towards the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's performance regresses as he struggles to keep up with his competitors.
